links.title: Breakdown Stocks Today | NYSE, NASDAQ and AMEX.
links.description: This scan helps traders identify today's breakdown stocks as they happen. Breakdown stocks are defined as those having moved below support levels. Breakdown stocks often exhibit sharp and sudden downward moves. At Stockbeep we use the 5-day range to indicate current resistance and support levels.

links.title: Unusual Volume Losers Today - Down On High Relative Volume (RVol) | NYSE, NASDAQ and AMEX
links.description: Unusual volume losers are stocks that are moving lower on unusually high volume. Increased volume flows are correlated with volatility. A heightened volume indicates something is going on today and that the stock is "in play". A stock moving down on unusually high volume typically implies distribution of the stock.

links.title: Epr Properties $EPR Trading Report
links.description: Stock Traders Daily is celebrating 20 years, providing proactive risk-controlled strategies all along, and this is a good example. When we couple this with out market based analysis, the probabilities of going with the flow increases, and that is material over time. The Epr Properties (NYSE: EPR) report below can help you, but we have more details too.

messages.body:
$EPR “Three tenants represent a significant portion of our lease revenues.
AMC, Topgolf and Regal, represent a significant portion of our total revenue. For the year ended December 31, 2019, of approximately $123.8 million or 17.6% were derived from rental payments by AMC, approximately $79.0 million or 11.2% were derived from rental payments by TopGolf and approximately $75.8 million or 10.8% were derived from rental payments by Regal.
If for any reason AMC, TopGolf and/or Regal failed to perform under their lease obligations, we could be required to reduce or suspend our shareholder dividends and may not have sufficient funds to support operations or service our debt until substitute tenants are obtained. If that happened, we cannot predict when or whether we could obtain substitute quality tenants on acceptable terms.”

$EPR Here’s what I’m confident will happen. Unfortunately we’re about to move into an epic period of Covid-19 and thanks to all of the knuckleheads and “masks are unconstitutional” fools. I can’t see anyway the theaters, privately own or a chain, can survive it.

EPR is nit going to retrofit and repurpose their property. Retail is dying. My bottom line is that EPR will sell their properties and distribute a special dividend to its preferred shareholders. That’s why they pay the premium of being a preferred shareholder not to mention the CxO suite.

links.title: U.S. vaccine program head Slaoui expects Pfizer, Moderna vaccine data readouts in November-December
links.description: (Reuters) - The chief adviser for the U.S. government's Operation Warp Speed COVID-19 vaccine program, Moncef Slaoui, on Tuesday said efficacy data readouts are expected from Pfizer Inc and Moderna Inc between next month and December.

messages.body: $EPR $SPG Looks like they're gunning tech and fear for one last stretch before the election. Vaccine and antibody news is imminent before December and a reevaluation of the multiples will lead to a 2001 sized crash.

$EPR drove by what used to be a movie theatre in cherry hill nj today. It’s now been repurposed into a restoration hardware or something along those lines. 

Don’t count epr out on repurposing some of those theatres, especially if they have time and money on their hands. 

The prefs are getting interesting here.
The Greatly Exaggerated Demise Of EPR Properties ($EPR) | Seeking Alpha https://seekingalpha.com/article/4378338-greatly-exaggerated-demise-of-epr-properties #REIT #investing

links.title: The Greatly Exaggerated Demise Of EPR Properties (NYSE:EPR)
links.description: Mark Twain, the American writer and humorist, in response to an English journalist who contacted him to ask whether the rumours that he was dead was true, famously replied stating that such reports of his death "were an exaggeration". After all, how else would one be able to respond to a journalist seeking comments on one's own death?
